title: President Trump Remarks on Missile Defense Review
description: President Trump traveled to the Pentagon to announce the results of the administration’s missile defense review. At the start, the president addressed the ongoing partial government shutdown and offered his condolences to the families of the four Americans killed in Syria. Acting Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan and Vice President Mike Pence provided introductory remarks.

title: Border Security National Emergency Resolution Veto
description: President Trump signed the first veto of his presidency by rejecting a resolution that would have terminated his national emergency declaration for the U.S.-Mexico border. Vice President Pence, Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen, Attorney General William Barr, several sheriffs from across the nation, and parents of victims killed by undocumented individuals joined the president in the Oval Office for the signing.

title: President Trump Rally in Grand Rapids, Michigan
description: President Trump held his first campaign rally since Attorney General William Barr released a summary of Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s report on Russian interference in the 2016 election. In his remarks, he covered a range of issues including the Mueller investigation, securing the border, and the economy. The president called the Mueller investigation “the single greatest hoax in the history of politics in our country.”

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Green Bay, Wisconsin
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Green Bay, Wisconsin. After offering condolences for victims of a shooting at a synagogue in California, the president talked about his administration’s first two years and urged the crowd to vote for Republicans in the 2020 election. His press secretary, Sarah Sanders, also made a brief appearance at the rally during which she criticized media coverage of President Trump.

title: President Trump Observes National Day of Prayer
description: President Trump, Vice President Pence, and the first and second ladies hosted an event recognizing National Prayer Day in the White House’s Rose Garden. They delivered remarks and heard prayers from a variety of faith leaders. There was also a musical performance by a church choir featuring Jonathan Cain, keyboardist for the band Journey.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Panama City Beach, Florida
description: At a campaign rally in Panama City Beach, Florida, President Trump pledged $448 million disaster relief for Hurricane Michael recovery efforts, and talked about U.S. policy toward Venezuela.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Montoursville, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Montoursville, Pennsylvania, where he was campaigning for Fred Keller, the Republican candidate for the state’s 12th Congressional District. He encouraged voters to elect Mr. Keller, who spoke briefly at the rally. The president also talked about the economy, jobs, border security, and the possibility of changing his campaign slogan from “Make America Great Again” to “Keep America Great.”

title: President Trump Remarks at Iowa Republican Dinner
description: President Trump delivered remarks at the Republican Party of Iowa annual dinner in West Des Moines.

title: President Trump Announces Second Term Run
description: President Trump announced he was running for a second term during a campaign rally at the Amway Center in Orlando. Vice President Pence made opening remarks, and first lady Melania Trump introduced the President. Outgoing press secretary Sarah Sanders also made brief remarks.

title: President Trump in Greenville, North Carolina
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Greenville, North Carolina, that included Vice President Mike Pence. The president mentioned congressional efforts to have him impeached and criticized four female freshman minority House members he recently tweeted about: Democratic Representatives Ilhan Omar (MN), Rashida Tlaib (MI), Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (NY), and Ayanna Pressley (MA).The president used language that some may find offensive.

title: President Trump in Cincinnati, Ohio
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Cincinnati, Ohio, at the U.S. Bank Arena. During his remarks, the president mentioned the previous night’s Democratic debate and how much time the candidates spent criticizing former President Barack Obama. He also suggested that Democrats were the cause for blight and violence in America’s inner cities.

title: President Trump Rally in Manchester, New Hampshire
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Manchester, New Hampshire at the SNHU Arena, He talked about such issues as the U.S.-Mexico border, the economy, China, and gun laws.

title: President Trump in Fayetteville, North Carolina
description: President Trump held a rally in Fayetteville, North Carolina, one day before a special election in the state’s 9th Congressional District.

title: Presidential Remarks on Religious Freedom
description: President Trump, in New York City for the annual United Nations General Assembly, spoke about religious freedom. He announced the U.S. would pledge $25 million in aid to protect religious freedom, sites, and relics. U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Kelly Knight Craft and Vice President Pence also spoke before the president.

title: President Trump Remarks at Hispanic Heritage Month Reception
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a Hispanic Heritage Month reception at the White House. The president spoke about job and wage increases for Hispanic Americans, home ownership and border protection. Vice President Mike Pence also delivered brief remarks.

title: New Chair of Joint Chiefs of Staff General Milley Swearing-in Ceremony
description: President Trump attended the swearing-in ceremony for his new Joint Chiefs of Staff xhair, General Mark Milley, at Joint Base Myer-Henderson Hall in Arlington, Virginia. Vice President Pence, outgoing Joint Chiefs of Staff General Dunford, and Defense Secretary Mark Esper also attended the ceremony.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Minneapolis
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Minneapolis. He touted his administration’s achievements, from border security and tax cuts, to reforming Veteran’s Affairs and growing the economy. He also criticized the media and the Democrats, saying the latter’s “brazen attempt to overthrow our government will produce a backlash at the ballot box.” He also made several mentions of former Vice President Joe Biden and his son Hunter for their involvement with Ukraine and China.

title: President Trump Rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Lake Charles, Louisiana. He touted his administration’s achievements, which included building the U.S.-Mexico wall, economy, and the recently-announced partial trade deal with China. In his remarks he criticized the media and House Democrats, calling Speaker Nancy Pelosi (R-CA) “Nervous Nancy.”

title: President Trump Rally in Dallas, Texas
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Dallas at the American Airlines Center He touted his administration’s achievements, including the recent announcement of a ceasefire with Turkey, in which he hopes to have a permanent deal done within five days. He also criticized the media and the Democrats, as well as expressing his disdain for House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) and House Intelligence Chair Adam Schiff (D-CA).

title: President Trump Remarks on NASA Spacewalk
description: President Trump spoke briefly from the White House Roosevelt Room with NASA’s first all-female spacewalk crew, astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir. After the short conversation, the president spoke briefly with the press, discussing the Ukraine investigation and the ceasefire in Turkey.

title: President Trump Rally in Tupelo, Mississippi
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Tupelo, Mississippi, ahead of the state’s gubernatorial election. He offered his support for the Republican candidate, Lieutenant Governor Tate Reeves, who was running against Jim Hood, the Democratic attorney general. The president also talked about the impeachment inquiry, the economy, and some of the 2020 Democratic presidential candidates.

title: President Trump Rally in Lexington, Kentucky
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Lexington, Kentucky. He was joined by Kentucky Governor Matt Bevin (R), a candidate for reelection, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY), and Senator Rand Paul (R-KY). Senator Paul in his remarks commented on the identity of the whistleblower whose complaint led to the impeachment inquiry of President Trump.

title: President Trump Rally in Monroe, Louisiana
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Monroe, Louisiana, a week and a half before the state’s runoff election for governor. He offered his support for the Republican candidate, businessman Eddie Rispone (R), who was running against the incumbent, Governor John Bel Edwards (D). The president talked about the impeachment inquiry, the economy, and the U.S. southern border and immigration. He also talked about 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Senator Elizabeth Warren (D-MA), saying she is “emerging from the ashes.” Joining the president on stage for brief remarks were Eddie Rispone, Senators Bill Cassidy (R-LA) and John Kennedy (R-LA), Representative Ralph Abraham (R-LA), and Phil and Willie Robertson from “Duck Dynasty.”

title: President Trump Remarks at "Black Voices for Trump" Rally
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a “Black Voices for Trump” rally in Atlanta. The president talked about his administration’s record and touted jobs creation and low unemployment for African Americans. He also commented on the impeachment inquiry, House Intelligence Committee Chair Adam Schiff (D-CA) and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA). Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson introduced the president.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Bossier City, Louisiana
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Bossier City, Louisiana, two days before the state’s gubernatorial runoff election. He offered his support for the Republican candidate, businessman Eddie Rispone (R), who was running against incumbent Governor John Bel Edwards (D). The president talked about the impeachment inquiry, calling it “deranged.” He also spoke about the economy, the military, and U.S. southern border wall. Joining the president on stage for brief remarks were Eddie Rispone, Louisiana Republican Senators Bill Cassidy and John Kennedy (R-LA), and U.S. Representative Ralph Abraham (R).

title: President Trump Rally in Sunrise, Florida
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Sunrise, Florida. It was his first rally there since changing his residency from New York to Florida in late October. He talked about the impeachment proceedings, telling his supporters that the Democrats are going after him for “fighting for you,” because he is “exposing a rigged system.” He also mentioned the economy, immigration and his recent visit to Walter Reed Medical Center.

title: President Trump Campaign Event in Hershey, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump and Vice President Pence urged Pennsylvania voters to put them back in the White House in 2020. The two held a campaign rally in Hershey, Pennsylvania touting the administration’s successes. They also criticized Democrats for their impeachment inquiry.

title: President Trump Rally in Battle Creek, Michigan
description: President Trump held a rally in Battle Creek, Michigan, as part of his 2020 re-election campaign. While the president spoke to supporters, the House of Representatives voted to impeach him for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

title: President Trump Remarks at Evangelical Rally
description: President Trump made campaign remarks during the launch of the “Evangelicals for Trump” coalition from El Rey Jesus Church in Miami. The president spoke of his commitment to protecting the rights of Christians and Evangelicals in the United States. He also mentioned the killing of Iranian General Qasem Soleimani by U.S. military forces, saying the general’s “bloody rampage is forever gone.”

title: President Trump Rally in Toledo, Ohio
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Toledo, Ohio. He spoke of several topics, including jobs in Ohio, the U.S.-Mexico border wall, and the U.S. military. He also talked about the killing of Iranian General Qasem Soleimani by a U.S. military drone strike, asserting that the general was plotting to bomb the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad before he was killed. Vice President Mike Pence introduced the president.

title: President Trump Rally in Milwaukee
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Mr. Trump touted the economy, and spoke about the border wall and prison reform. He also mentioned the killing of Iranian General Qasem Soleimani, and briefly talked about impeachment, calling it a “witch hunt.”

title: U.S.-China Trade Deal
description: President Trump signed phase one of the U.S.-China trade agreement from the East Room of the White House. The agreement places protections on intellectual property, ensures investment into U.S. agriculture and manufacturing, and has measures in place to prohibit currency manipulation. Joining the president for the signing was Chinese Vice Premier Liu He.

title: "March for Life" Rally
description: President Trump addressed the annual March for Life rally in Washington, D.C. He was the first U.S. president to speak in person at the event. The two-hour rally also included remarks by Vice President Pence and Karen Pence, congressional lawmakers, Focus on the Family’s Jim Daly, and several “pro-life” activists.

title: President Trump Rally in Wildwood, New Jersey
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Wildwood, New Jersey. He was joined onstage by Representative Jeff Van Drew (R-NJ), who had recently switched to the Republican party, and White House Counselor Kellyanne Conway.

title: President Trump Rally in Des Moines, Iowa
description: President Trump held a rally at Drake University in Des Moines, Iowa, just a few days before the Hawkeye state’s 2020 presidential caucuses. He touted the newly signed U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade deal, as well as the recent deal with China, and he talked about investment in agriculture, border security, and health care. Briefly mentioning his impeachment trial, he called it a “happy period for us” and “impeachment light.”

title: President Trump at White House Summit on Human Trafficking
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a White House summit on human trafficking. He was joined by Vice President Mike Pence and Bella Hounakey, a human trafficking survivor. Following his remarks, the president signed an executive order. The summit was hosted in honor of the 20th anniversary of the Trafficking Victims Protections Act (TVPA).

title: President Trump Rally in Manchester, New Hampshire
description: President Trump held a campaign rally at Southern New Hampshire University in Manchester, one day before the Granite State’s first-in-the-nation primary election.

title: President Trump Campaign Event in Phoenix, Arizona
description: President Trump held a “Keep America Great” rally in Phoenix at the Arizona Veterans Memorial Coliseum. He talked about the economy, jobs, new trade deals, and the progress made with the U.S.-Mexico border wall. He also spoke about former New Yok City Mayor Mike Bloomberg’s entry into the field of 2020 Democratic presidential candidates, referring to him as “Mini Mike.”

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Colorado Springs, Colorado
description: President Trump held a 'Keep America Great" rally in Colorado Springs, Colorado. He talked about the economy, border security, immigration, trade, and Space Force. While talking about the previous night’s Democratic presidential debate, he referenced Mike Bloomberg, saying “Mini-Mike didn’t do well last night,” before turning his attention to Senator Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), saying that she is done, that “she choked.”

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Las Vegas
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Las Vegas. During the rally, he addressed reports that Russia is meddling to help his re-reelection campaign saying, “they’re trying to start a rumor, it’s disinformation…Wouldn’t he rather have, let’s say, Bernie, who honeymooned in Moscow.”

title: President Trump Campaign Event in North Charleston, South Carolina
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in North Charleston, South Carolina, on the eve of the Democratic primary in the Palmetto State. The president praised his administration’s efforts to respond to the coronavirus outbreak. He also criticized the 2020 Democratic presidential candidates and made his case for re-election. “At stake in our present battle, is the actual survival of our nation-I really believe that,” he said. “You see these maniacs that we’re dealing with. They want to give away everything.”

title: President Trump Rally in Charlotte, North Carolina
description: President Trump spoke to a crowd of supporters at a campaign rally in Charlotte, North Carolina. He talked about the economy, the 2020 presidential race, and the federal response to the coronavirus outbreak.

title: President and First Lady Celebrate Earth Day and Arbor Day
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump participated in a tree planting ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House in celebration of Earth Day and Arbor Day. The president, Vice President Mike Pence, second lady Karen Pence and House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) delivered remarks before the tree planting.

title: President Trump Remarks on National Day of Prayer
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump made remarks at the National Day of Prayer Service in the Rose Garden at the White House. Vice President Mike Pence and second lady Karen Pence also spoke.

title: Restaurant Executives Meeting at the White House
description: President Trump met with restaurant and industry executives at the White House to discuss the coronavirus pandemic response and reopening the economy. The industry leaders all agreed the Paycheck Protection Program had helped their businesses and asked the administration to consider a 24-week extension to the program. The president took questions from reporters and said he was “surprised” by the statement from Attorney General Barr earlier in the day, saying he does not foresee the Justice Department probe into the origins of the Russia investigation to lead to a criminal investigation of former President Obama or former Vice President Biden. President Trump also talked about his firing of State Department Inspector General Steve Linick, saying he had the right to terminate as president. He also stated that he had been taking hydroxychloroquine as a preventive measure against COVID-19 despite warnings from the medical community against its safety.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma
description: President Trump, in his first campaign rally since the coronavirus pandemic forced a shutdown of the country in March, spoke at a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma. He talked about the pandemic, presidential politics, and the economy.

title: President Trump Delivers Remarks at Student Convention
description: President Trump spoke at a rally with students hosted by Turning Point USA in Phoenix, Arizona. “Ten years is a long time to spend in prison,” said the president while alluding to the punishment for protesters who damage monuments or attempt to take down statues. President Trump also talked about the coronavirus pandemic and testing, the U.S.-Mexico border wall, and the economy.

title: President Trump on COVID-19 and School Safety
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump participated in a roundtable discussion with students, parents, teachers and medical professionals on efforts to reopen schools in the fall amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: President Trump Remarks on Rolling Back Regulations
description: President Trump delivered remarks from the White House South Lawn on deregulation. He touted his administration’s rescission of regulations, saying that doing so would help spur the economy and bring jobs back to the United States. The president also asserted that the plan of his Democratic presidential opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden, would threaten “our entire economy, and very way of life.”

title: President Trump Remarks in Oshkosh, Wisconsin
description: President Trump delivered remarks to a crowd in Oshkosh, Wisconsin, where he spoke about jobs and the economy, his handling of the coronavirus pandemic, recent protests across the nation and the 2020 presidential election campaign. He commented on former first lady Michelle Obama’s taped remarks scheduled to air during the opening night of the Democratic National Convention. He also compared himself to 2020 Democratic presumptive presidential nominee Joe Biden on a range of issues.

title: President Trump Delivers Remarks in Mankato, Minnesota
description: In Mankato, Minnesota, President Trump delivered remarks on the economy. He also spoke about recent protests in the state, the federal government response to the coronavirus pandemic, and negotiations with congressional Democrats on additional COVID-19 aid. He compared himself to 2020 presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden on a range of issues.

title: President Trump Remarks in Yuma, Arizona, on Immigration
description: President Trump delivered remarks on border security and immigration at a campaign-style event held from an airplane hangar in Yuma, Arizona. The president spoke about the border wall, the decline in illegal border crossings, and the policies his administration had put in place, such as ending “catch-and-release” and overhauling the work-visa program. He also spoke about the first night of the Democratic National Convention, calling former first lady Michelle Obama’s speech “divisive” and “obsolete.”

title: President Trump Receives Update on Border Wall Construction
description: President Trump spoke with the press in Yuma, Arizona, after being updated on border wall construction. When he was asked about the recently completed Senate Intelligence Committee report on the 2016 presidential election, which documented Russian interference, President Trump said he knew nothing about it, later reasserting his claims that the Russia investigation was a “hoax.”

title: President Trump Remarks in Pennsylvania
description: President Trump gave remarks in Old Forge, Pennsylvania, near Scranton, the latter being the hometown of his Democratic challenger, Joe Biden. His remarks coincided with the final day of the 2020 Democratic National Convention.

title: President Trump Remarks at Council For National Policy Meeting
description: President Trump gave campaign-style remarks at the 2020 Council for National Policy meeting in Arlington, Virginia. He compared his actions in office to that of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden while he served as vice president. He also outlined what he would do to address certain policy issues versus what his opponent would do. President Trump heavily criticized the use of mail-in voting during the COVID-19 pandemic and warned supporters that they might never know the outcome of the election.

title: President Trump Campaign Event in Latrobe, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign event in Latrobe, Pennsylvania. He listed his administration’s accomplishments and addressed the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: President Trump Campaign Event in Winston-Salem, North Carolina
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign event held at the Winston-Salem, North Carolina, airport.

title: President Trump Remarks in Freeland, Michigan
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Freeland, Michigan. During his remarks, he talked about a variety of domestic and foreign affairs issues, including his decision to move the U.S. embassy in Israel to Jerusalem and his summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. He also remarked on his nomination by a Norwegian lawmaker for the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize, and about journalist and author Bob Woodward’s reporting on his administration’s response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Reno, Nevada
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally held at an airport in Minden, Nevada, near Lake Tahoe. He talked about his support for law enforcement, the federal response to the coronavirus pandemic, and rebuilding the economy. He repeated his previous criticisms of former Vice President and 2020 Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, calling him “Sleepy Joe” and saying that he would destroy the suburbs if elected. Early in his remarks, President Trump spoke about Nevada Governor Steve Sisolak (D), saying he was trying to stop the Trump campaign from holding the rally and suggested the governor was trying “to rig the election” because “he’s in control of millions of votes.”

title: President Trump Holds Campaign Rally in Henderson, Nevada
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Las Vegas. During his remarks, the president urged Nevada Governor Sisolak to “open up your state.” The governor criticized the president for holding the indoor rally, which violated a state mandate limiting gatherings to 50 people.

title: "Latinos for Trump" Roundtable in Las Vegas
description: President Trump hosted a ‘Latinos for Trump’ campaign roundtable at the Treasure Island Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, a property owned by Phil Ruffin, a business partner of the Trump Organization. At the top of the event, President Trump talked about some of his administration’s first-term actions aimed at lowering Latino unemployment. Then the participants, most of them small business owners in the Las Vegas area, talked about why they were supporting President Trump’s campaign for reelection. The roundtable was part of a multi-state swing through Western states, including Nevada, California, and Arizona.

title: President Trump Hosts "Latinos for Trump" Roundtable in Phoenix
description: President Trump hosted a “Latinos for Trump” roundtable at the Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix.

title: President Trump Remarks at White House History Conference
description: President Trump made remarks at the White House History Conference at the National Archives in Washington, D.C. During his remarks, the president denounced what he called “left wing mob,” saying a “radical movement is moving to demolish our precious history.” He later said the “left” wanted “to impose a new segregation.” President Trump announced a new executive order to promote “patriotic education,” called the 1776 Commission. Vice President Pence introduced the president.

title: President Trump Rally in Mosinee, Wisconsin
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a “Great American Comeback” event in Mosinee, Wisconsin.

title: President Trump Campaign Remarks in Bemidji, Minnesota
description: President Trump gave remarks at a “Great American Comeback” rally in Bemidji, Minnesota, held in support of his campaign for reelection. It was among his longest-ever campaign speeches, and covered a variety of topics, including his 2016 match-up against Democrat Hillary Clinton, his 2020 challenger Democrat Joe Biden, and many of his campaign’s cornerstone issues, including support for law enforcement and strong border controls.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Fayetteville, North Carolina
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Fayetteville, North Carolina, where he talked about a COVID-19 vaccine, supporting law enforcement, and the sale of Tik Tok, the Chinese video-sharing social networking service. While discussing 2020 Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, he called the former vice president “the dumbest candidate” in history. After paying homage to the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who died the previous day, the president said he plans to announce his nominee to replace her in the coming week, and that it would be a woman.

title: President Trump Campaign Remarks Near Dayton, Ohio
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a rally held at Dayton International Airport in western Ohio.

title: President Trump Campaign Remarks in Swanton, Ohio
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally at the Toledo Express Airport in Swanton, Ohio.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Pittsburgh
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a rally held at Pittsburgh International Airport.

title: President Trump Delivers Remarks on Bay of Pigs Remembrance
description: President Trump delivered remarks honoring veterans of the Bay of Pigs invasion.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Jacksonville, Florida
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Jacksonville, Florida. He talked about a variety of domestic and foreign policy issues, and also about his forthcoming pick of a replacement for the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

title: President Trump Hosts "Latinos for Trump" Roundtable in Miami
description: President Trump hosts a “Latinos for Trump” roundtable discussion in Miami.

title: President Trump Remarks on Black Economic Empowerment in Atlanta
description: President Trump made remarks in Atlanta on his plan to boost economic opportunities for Black Americans. President Trump said the Platinum Plan would boost federal dollars targeted for investment in Black businesses and communities and create new opportunities to change policing and law enforcement policy throughout the U.S. He was introduced by Herschel Walker, a retired professional football player.

title: President Trump Rally in Newport News, Virginia
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Newport News, Virginia. He was introduced by Vice President Mike Pence.

title: President Trump Rally in Middletown, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump held a campaign rally in Middletown, Pennsylvania, a few miles from the state capital of Harrisburg. He spoke about his handling of coronavirus pandemic, support for law enforcement, bringing back manufacturing jobs to the country, and the need to protect the election from fraud that he has attributed to the use of mail-in ballots. He also discussed his nominee to the Supreme Court, Judge Amy Coney Barrett.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Duluth, Minnesota
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a rally in support of his reelection held at Duluth International Airport in Minnesota, near the state’s border with Wisconsin. It was his first campaign event since the first presidential debate against Democratic challenger Joe Biden, which was held in Cleveland the evening prior. During his remarks, President Trump claimed victory in the debate before making his case as to why he was the best choice for Minnesotans as they voted in the 2020 election. Afterward, President Trump boarded Air Force One to return to the White House.

title: President Trump Remarks from the White House
description: President Trump delivered brief remarks at a “law and order” rally from the White House. The president was greeted with cheers, telling those gathered that he “felt great.” This was the president’s first in-person event since his return to the White House from Walter Reed Medical Center after testing positive for COVID-19.

title: President Trump Hosts Rally in Sanford, Florida
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Sanford, Florida, his first public event outside of the White House since being diagnosed with COVID-19 earlier in October 2020. His remarks hit on a number of his signature campaign issues, including the economy, trade, immigration, and border security.

title: President Trump Holds Campaign Rally in Johnstown, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Johnstown, Pennsylvania. He talked about a number of his signature campaign issues during the address, including the economy, trade, and his support of natural gas fracking in states like Pennsylvania. He also accused Joe Biden, the Democratic presidential nominee, of “abandoning” his home state of of Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Holds Campaign Rally in Des Moines, Iowa
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Iowa’s capital of Des Moines.

title: President Trump Delivers Remarks to the New York Economic Club
description: President Trump delivered remarks on the economy to a virtual gathering of the Economic Club of New York. He touted his administration’s record on the economy and talked about its efforts to stimulate economic growth amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, and compared his policies to those of his 2020 Democratic nominee Joe Biden. He also answered questions from economic club leaders in Florida and Washington, D.C.

title: President Trump Rally in Greenville, North Carolina
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Greenville, North Carolina, less than three weeks before Election Day and on the first day of voting in the state. During his remarks, President Trump spoke of a number of his campaign’s cornerstone issues, including the economy, trade, and border security. He also criticized Governor Roy Cooper (D-NC) for his handling of the coronavirus pandemic and urged him to reopen the state. The president also talked about a recent New York Post story regarding 2020 Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden’s son, Hunter.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Ocala, Florida
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Ocala, Florida.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Macon, Georgia
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Macon, Georgia, his second such event that day. This rally followed earlier remarks in Florida. During his remarks in Georgia, President Trump talked about many of his signature campaign issues, including the economy, trade and border security. He also criticized his Democratic opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden, for his economic plan and his proposals to combat the coronavirus pandemic.

title: President Trump Rally in Muskegon, Michigan
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Muskegon, Michigan. He began his remarks by assailing what he called the “radical left,” saying they would “erase American history” and “purge American values.” When speaking on the election, the president declared a “red wave” was coming, claiming that he was in the lead with early voting. While decrying state shutdowns due to the pandemic, President Trump addressed the kidnapping plot against the Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer (D), saying, “I guess they said she was threatened, and she blamed me; she blamed me.”

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Janesville, Wisconsin
description: President Trump delivers spoke at a campaign rally in Janesville, Wisconsin.

title: President Trump Holds Campaign Rally in Nevada's Capital
President Trump Campaign Rally in Tucson, Arizona
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Tucson, Arizona.

title: President Trump Campaign Event in Erie, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Erie, Pennsylvania, in support of his reelection.

title: President Trump Campaigns in Gastonia, North Carolina
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a rally in support of his re-election held in Gastonia, North Carolina.

title: President Trump Campaigns in The Villages, Florida
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in The Villages, Florida, one of the world’s largest retirement communities.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Pensacola, Florida
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Pensacola, Florida.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Circleville, Ohio
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Circleville, Ohio. He began by touting the return of Big Ten football. While speaking about the economy, health care, and the coronavirus, the president took several opportunities to assail his opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden. During the rally, the President played a video clip of former Vice President Biden talking about fracking, a topic on which the two disagreed in their last debate.

title: President Trump Campaigns in New Hampshire
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally near New Hampshire’s largest city, Manchester. His remarks covered a variety of domestic and foreign affairs topics, and largely focused on his administration’s economic policies, which he said had been severely hampered by the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. He also talked about his political record in New Hampshire, which was the first state he won in the 2016 Republican presidential primaries. President Trump’s visit to New Hampshire came just more than a week before Election Day, as the latest RealClearPolitics polling average had him running 11 points behind in the state to his Democratic challenger, Joe Biden.

title: President Trump Campaigns in Martinsburg, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally near Altoona, Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in West Salem, Wisconsin
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in West Salem, Wisconsin.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Omaha, Nebraska
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Omaha, Nebraska. At the beginning of his remarks, the president said that “this election is a choice between the Trump super recovery, which is what we’re having, or a Biden depression, sad to say.” While touting his administration’s accomplishments, President Trump said that the country was “making that final turn” on the coronavirus pandemic and that the nation needs to get back to normal.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Lansing, Michigan
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Lansing, Michigan.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Goodyear, Arizona
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Goodyear, Arizona. He also reacted to news that former Homeland Security Department official Miles Taylor was the author of an anonymous 2018 New York Times opinion piece critical of the president.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Bullhead City, Arizona
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Bullhead City, Arizona, on the Nevada border with less than a week to go until Election Day.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Tampa, Florida
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Tampa. He talked about several issues, including the economy, China, and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden. He also commented on the news that former Homeland Security official Miles Taylor was the anonymous author of a 2018 New York Time opinion piece, calling him a “lowlife” and “disgrace to our country” who should be prosecuted.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Rochester, Minnesota
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Rochester, Minnesota. Due to state mandated coronavirus pandemic restrictions, the campaign had to limit the attendance to 250 people. Speaking about the crowd limitation, President Trump decried the mandate, saying that Governor Tim Walz (D) and state Attorney General Keith Ellison (D) “tried to shut-down our rally, silence the people of Minnesota, and take away your freedom, and your rights.” Due to technical difficulties, a small portion of the president’s remarks could not be shown.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Butler, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Montoursville, PA
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Montoursville, Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Reading, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Reading, Pennsylvania.

title: President Trump Holds Rally in Hickory, North Carolina
description: President Trump spoke at a rally in Hickory, North Carolina, one of his five scheduled campaign stops on the last Sunday before Election Day. President Trump won North Carolina in the 2016 election.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Kenosha, Wisconsin
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

title: President Trump and Vice President Pence Speak at Campaign Rally in Traverse City, Michigan
description: President Trump and Vice President Mike Pence spoke at a campaign rally in Traverse City, Michigan. There are about 16 minutes between the vice president and president’s remarks.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally Near Scranton, Pennsylvania
description: President Trump delivered remarks at a campaign rally in Avoca, Pennsylvania, near Scranton, the hometown of 2020 Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.

title: President Trump Campaign Rally in Fayetteville, North Carolina
description: President Trump spoke at a campaign rally in Fayetteville, North Carolina.

title: President Trump Remarks on Election Status
description: President Trump delivered remarks from the East Room of the White House on Election Night, before the race had been called. The president thanked his supporters and talked about the states he had won. President Trump also claimed that there were irregularities in the vote counting process. “This is a fraud on the American public. This is an embarrassment to our country. We were getting ready to win this election. Frankly, we did win this election,” he said.

title: President Trump Remarks on Election Results
description: President Trump made his first remarks at the White House two days after Election Day and without a declared winner in the presidential race. “This is a case where they’re trying to steal an election. They’re trying to rig an election and we can’t let that happen,” said the president without providing evidence to back his assertions. President Trump claimed that mail-in ballots inherently led to “corruption” and election workers “finding” these ballots during the counting process amounted to election fraud. The president said his campaign would pursue legal action, including going to the Supreme Court.

title: President Trump Statement on 2020 Election Results
description: The White House posted remarks on Facebook from President Trump about his view of voting and election security in the 2020 election. In the recorded statement, the president provided examples of what he described as fraudulent activity related to mail-in voting in several swing states.

title: President Trump Campaigns for U.S. Senate Runoffs in Georgia
description: President Trump spoke at a rally in Valdosta, GA in support of Georgia Republican Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler, both facing runoff elections in early January. The president asserted his claims that he was the winner of the presidential election. “If I lost, I’d be a very gracious loser,” said the president, later saying he would go to Florida “and take it easy.” Proclaiming they will win this election, President Trump - without making a commitment - said in “2024, and hopefully I won’t have to be a candidate, we’re going to win back the White House again.”

title: President Trump Remarks at Georgia U.S. Senate Campaign Event
description: President Trump spoke at a Dalton, Georgia, rally in support of Senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler, both candidates in Georgia’s two 2020 U.S. Senate runoff elections. Mr. Perdue did not attend the rally because he was quarantined after coming into contact with someone who tested for COVID-19 within the previous week. President Trump encouraged voters to vote for the two Republican candidates, noting that a win for their Democratic challengers would hand control of the Senate to Democrats. Most of the president’s remarks concerned his displeasure with the results of the 2020 presidential election, which he lost in both the popular vote and the Electoral College. He said his supporters in Congress would continue to support him as both legislative chambers were set to accept the Electoral College results in just two days. Senator Loeffler, Representative Majrorie Taylor Greene (R-GA), and Ivanka Trump, the president’s daughter, also spoke during the rally.

title: Rally on Electoral College Vote Certification
description: President Trump spoke at a rally in Washington, D.C., held to protest the results of the Electoral College, which Congress was set to count later that day. “We will never give up. We will never concede,” he declared. President Trump repeated his unsubstantiated claims of fraud in both the November election and the Georgia U.S. Senate runoff election held the previous night. He railed against Republicans he deemed insufficiently supportive of his efforts to overturn the results and promised to “primary the hell out of the ones that don’t fight.” The president also continued to publicly pressure his vice president, Mike Pence, to reject electoral votes in states that he lost. As the speech was concluding, Vice President Pence issued a statement saying he lacked the constitutional authority to dismiss the votes when Congress met later that day.Note: Because of audio difficulties with the president’s microphone, there was no audio during the first 38 seconds of his remarks.
